page.title: 17Employment in Whitminster.
page.content:
Continued from page 16.
The final example of a local employer is far more traditional. {FROMEBRIDGE {MILL}is a flour mill that was mentioned in the original Domesday Book. The mill employs two men, one to run the office and another to load and unload lorries and run the mill itself. The mill buys oats, barley, wheat and maize in bulk from farmers and grind it to sell as food for horses, chickens and cattle. Farmers can also take their own cereals there to be ground for use on their own farms.
The mill is still driven by water power from a weir on the river Frome. The water power used to run a cider press at the mill as well. Continued on page 18.
